posts.name: Bonez
posts.cooked:
Nvidia‚Äôs return/refund policy is 30 days, there is no option or way to return the item from the online store where it was purchased. When I opened a support chat, they said they can‚Äôt return it either. On the order history page it says:

‚ÄùOrder Status: Completed
Quantity Shipped: 1
Quantity Eligible for Return: 0‚Äù

How is my item not eligible to be returned, it just arrived today, and it‚Äôs not even opened. Clearly a flaw in the website design, but could use some help here Nvidia.

posts.name: ashreaperone
posts.cooked: Mine is already open. I would also like to return it! I spent over six hours trying to figure out why it wasn‚Äôt rebooting. Very disappointing ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Hi Bonez and Ashreaperone, for refund or RMA requests, please reach out to my colleagues at NVIDIA Customer Support Resources

posts.name: Bonez
posts.cooked: I‚Äôve done that, they said they can not create an RMA/Return for me.
Bonez, please DM me. share with me the email address you used to communicate with support, and we‚Äôll sort it out for you.

posts.name: Bonez
posts.cooked: Just an update here for those that dm‚Äôd me, the option to return it eventually showed up on my order history page, it just took a couple days to update after it arrived. I was able to file a return to return it.

posts.name: Elsaco
posts.cooked: @ashreaperone and @bonez what made you decide to return the overpriced Raspberry Pi, a.k.a. DGX-Spark?

posts.name: ashreaperone
posts.cooked: @elsaco I haven‚Äôt returned mine yet‚Ä¶ My first experience with NVIDIA has been disappointing since my reservation, followed by numerous issues with the DGX Spark since rebooting to connecting. I‚Äôve been worried that any problems might come up after the one year warranty period expires. Although it‚Äôs expensive for me, I really want to learn and experiment with local LLMs without paying cloud providers‚Ä¶ as well as using it for other use cases like RL, Deep learning,‚Ä¶etc. I was initially excited after watching Jensen‚Äôs announcement, but now I‚Äôm not so sure man (I tried to watch a lot of reviews before purchasing it, most of them were not frank‚Ä¶ lol a lot of influencers‚Ä¶ ) Perhaps I‚Äôlll keep it or consider returning it if it‚Äôs still allowed. I still need to weight my options .

posts.name: Bonez
posts.cooked: For me it was straight forward, the performance just wasn‚Äôt where I wanted it to be. I think NVidia really missed the mark here, they had a huge opportunity, the GPU should have been a 5090/RTX 6000 level GPU, then it would have been a game changer, but this to me is more of a dev box that could be useful to learn, develop and build and then send that work to a higher class machine to do the real work. If you have a full CUDA stack and need something on your desk to do that work without using a larger more capable piece of hardware, cool this is a good tool for that. The real benefit to this machine is the memory footprint, if you‚Äôre ok with things running slow but fitting bigger models in, great, it‚Äôs a handy little device but if you want anything performant or to use in a real work flow this falls short in my opinion.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
